ARABIC: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: for any of you who want to go forward or hang back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Whoever of you desires to progress or lag behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: a warning to everyone of you whether he would like to come forward or lag behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: whether one steps forward to embrace the faith or one turns away from it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: For the one among you who wishes to come forward or stay back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: To any of you that chooses to go forward, or to remain behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: To him among you who wishes to go forward or remain behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: to whoever of you desires to go forward or lag behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Unto him of you who will advance or hang back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: alike to every one of you, who want to go forward or hang back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: A warning Unto him of you who shall go forward or who chooseth to lag behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [alike] for those of you who like to advance ahead and those who would remain behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: To any of you that chooses to press forward, or to follow behind;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: To any of you that chooses to go forward (by working righteous deeds), or to remain behind (by commiting sins),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: to whoever among you desires to go forward, or lag behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: To whomever among you wishes to advance, or regress.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: To whoever wills among you to proceed or stay behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:37] [alike] to those of you who wish (li-man shā’a minkum is a substitution for li’l-bashar, ‘to [all] humans’) to advance, towards good, or towards Paradise by means of faith, or linger behind, in evil, or in Hell because of [their] disbelief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Unto him of you who will advance) towards goodness (or hang back) from evil and therefore holds back from it; it is also said this means: or hang back from goodness and therefore disbelieve; this being a threat to them.
